{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question states that the child was healthy 2 days prior to admission. This suggests an acute onset of symptoms. The patient is presenting with severe respiratory distress and shock, which are indicative of a cardiac issue. Given the sudden onset and severe symptoms, a congenital heart defect is a possible diagnosis. Among the options, VSD (A) and Hypoplastic left heart syndrome (B) are more likely to cause acute respiratory distress and shock.", "answer_choice": "A"}
